titles: Tristitiæ Christianæ: or An ocean of pious tears. An elegy upon the death of the reverend, pious, and learned minister of the gospel, Mr. Matthew Mead, who departed this life at his dwelling-house in Stepney, on Monday, the 16th day of this instant October, 1699. In the sixty ninth year of his age. / Written by a constant auditor, and sorrowful mourner, for the loss of this reverend deceased pastor.
publisher: printed and sold by J. Bradford, in Little Britain, over against the Pump.,
notes: Verse: "A woeful story here I'm come to tell,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Mead, Matthew, 1630?-1699 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
